pr_title: GEODE-8603: Potentially expand classes identified for CI stressing to include subclasses

timeline.message: Expand sub classes indicated by StressNewTest

Order classpath correctly and run devBuild and printTestClasspath separately

Authored-by: Jens Deppe <jdeppe@vmware.com>
Also work with actual java files

timeline.bodyText: Is this possibly missing running concrete classes that also have subclasses? Like someone extended a real test with more subclasses?
timeline.author: upthewaterspout

replies.bodyText: In that case the selected subclass would end up executing tests in the super. A test could be missed if the subclass overrides a test in the super.
replies.author: jdeppe-pivotal

timeline.message:
Make StressNewTestHelper create the complete gradle test task commands

- Since some tests may have subclasses in different source sets, (which
  would require a different repeat task name), it's easier for the
  command generation to all happen in the java helper rather than a
  combination of bash and java.

Authored-by: Jens Deppe <jdeppe@vmware.com>
Only use those tasks that are defined
Include candidate test class if it is not abstract

Various changes:

- Output a fake Gradle param so that scripts can determine the number of
  tests included.
- Change the CI stress job timeout from 6 to 10 hours.
- Increase the test count threshold from 25 to 35 changed tests. This
  number also includes any tests inferred by this new code.

Authored-by: Jens Deppe <jdeppe@vmware.com>
Ubuntu 20 does not include python 2.7 anymore

timeline.bodyText: was this intended to be left in?
timeline.author: onichols-pivotal

replies.bodyText: Thanks for pointing that out - I'll remove it.
replies.author: jdeppe-pivotal
